    Build Your Own Blog


    Writing here has gotten me thinking more deeply about things I come across everyday. Talking comes naturally to me and I can spend days having conversations with friends with no real agenda, but I am not as good at writing concrete material and I wanted to work towards changing that. Thinking while speaking with someone usually gets me to a level or two, but writing down forces me to solidify my reflection on a thought.

  • April 27, 2014

    Does Your API Empathize With Its User?


    I am appalled at the difference in API usability between an API developed for B2B (Business to Business) vs. one developed for B2C (Business to Customer). A good example of a B2B API in the finance world is the 15022 swift messaging (primarily used for communication between two financial institutions) which look like a 5 year old’s half eaten bowl of spaghetti. Compare that to a B2C API like Parse (a Backend as a service application) which has a beautifully designed API which is a pleasure to work with as a developer.

    Read More...
